summary: ChildWorkflowStub incorrectly caches RunID when sending signals to child workflows that have continued. When a child workflow continues, its RunID changes, but the stub still uses the old RunID, causing signal delivery to fail.
userImpact: Users cannot reliably send signals to child workflows that have continued, forcing them to use ExternalWorkflowStub as a workaround.
rootCause: ChildWorkflowStub caches the RunID at stub creation time and reuses it for signal delivery, but RunID changes when a workflow continues.
workaround: Use ExternalWorkflowStub instead of ChildWorkflowStub for sending signals to child workflows that may continue.
keyQuote: Signal is erroring as RunID changed but cached in WorkflowStub.
